item.title: How Marriott’s commitment to ‘career acceleration’ elevates women leaders
item.description: Women make up nearly half of the board and 50% of Marriott International CEO Tony Capuano’s direct reports, far above the industry average.

item.title: U.S. national debt hits $38 trillion and Washington is ‘numb to our own dysfunction,’ budget committee warns
item.description: America's debt mountain is eye-watering. The interest alone costs $1.21 trillion annually— 17% of total federal spending.

item.title: Cybersecurity experts warn OpenAI’s ChatGPT Atlas is vulnerable to attacks that could turn it against a user—revealing sensitive data, downloading malware, or worse
item.description: Experts caution that AI-powered browsers like ChatGPT Atlas could open the door to new kinds of attacks—from prompt injections to data leaks—as artifi...

item.title: Corning CEO says Steve Jobs pressured him into making all the screens for the first iPhone: ‘Do you know what your biggest problem is? You’re afraid’
item.description: According to Wendell Weeks, Jobs said if Corning couldn't help Apple deliver on "the biggest product in history ... I'm going to eviscerate you."

item.title: A recession could test whether AI is truly fueling an economy with ‘jobless growth’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.
